shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 5r-147v) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 5r-110v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 111r-122r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 122v-128v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 131ra-144va)
Additiones 1-7.

copyists.copyist: The name of the scribe has been erased from the supplication on fol. 144a, but one part, Gäbrä, can still be discerned. The full name was possibly Gäbrä ʾIyäsus.

owners.owner: According to Additio 4, the Ms. belongs to Zä-Wäldä Maryam. The name of Wälättä Ḥǝywät has been erased from the subscriptio (supplication) on fol. 144vb but can still be discerned.

txstates.txstate: The overback is damaged. The front board attachement is damaged. The Ms. was resewn. Fols. 1-4 (quire A) are loose. A hole is burnt into fol. 8. Many fols. are stained with wax and dirt. Additional fols. with illuminations have been inserted in a recent time: fols. 93, 94, 129, 130. A cut on fol. 60 has been carefully amended.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Overback made of reddish-brown untooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: cross hatching, double circle, wave form, single line fillet, small x).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire:
A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፪II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – ፫III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – ፭V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – [፲]X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 85-92v) – <XII(2/ fols. 93r-94v)> – ፲፪XIII(8; s.l.: 1, stub after 8; 8, stub after 1/fols. 95r-102v) – ፲፫XIV(8/fols. 103r-110v) – XV(8/fols. 111r-118v) – ፲፬XVI(10/fols. 119r-128v) – <XVII(2/fols. 129r-130v)> – XVIII(8/fols. 131r-138v) – ፲፮XIX(9; s.l. 8, stub after 1/fols. 139r-147v).
Quires XII and XVII were probably inserted at a later time.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 9r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling

taunit.mr-info: Text I-4: all data for fol. 135r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of God in Text I-1; name of St. Mary in Text I-4); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; letters ይ, ር and ዎ of the word ይባርክዎ in Canticle 10 (fols. 118v-119v); initial word or an abbreviation of the refrain in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs and the text dividers.
A few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1 to I-4. Two groups of lines (alternating with black lines) of the incipit of the daily readings in Text I-4.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እ᎓/እስ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fols. 102v-103r). ስቡ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 118v-119v). Text I-4 ሰ፡/ሰ፡ አ፡ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡/ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 131r-v) እ᎓/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነ (fols. 132r-133r) ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 133v-134v). ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 135v-136v) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 137ra-vb) ተ፡/ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 138va-139ra) ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 139va-140rb).

additional.det: The note is damaged by water and partly abraded; it is for the most part illegible.

additional.cont: Fols. 2va-3vb: Mälkəˁa ˀIyäsus “Image of Jesus” (ChRep 199, no. 122), continuation of Additio 7.
additional.det: The prayer is written in a fine hand, in red and black ink. A curious way of sloping the top part of the letters ረ and ፈ. The incipit of the text is on fol. 144vb (Additio 8).
The note is carelessly written; it praises different angels for defence against evil demons, etc.
The note is written in the main hand, in red. It states that the book belongs to Zä-Wäldä Maryam.
The note is written in the lower part of the leaf, in a later hand, damaged by water. It invokes ʾasmat-names.
The note is written in a later, careless hand, probably as a writing exercise. It states that the Ms. belongs to šum ʿagame Gäbrä Täkle (Gäbrä Täklä Haymanot). The same hand wrote Additio 5.

additional.cont: Fols. 144vb-147rb: Mälkəˁa ˀIyäsus “Image of Jesus” (ChRep 199, no. 122).
additional.det: Written by the same hand as Additio 1. It is the incipit for the text continuing in Additio 2. At the end (fol. 147vb) the words ተመለስ፡ ለሐቌከ፡ እ ("return to: ለሐቌከ፡ እ") indicate exactly where the text is to be resumed; ለሐቌከ፡ እ[ንዘቦ] are the beginning words of Additio 2 (on fol. 2va).

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating red and black dots. No separation between Pss. 10/11, 30/31, 150/151. - Numerous directives on use of the Pss. for protective and medical purposes are written in the upper margin or at the end of the lines, in a fine secondary hand: fols. 5r, 6r, 6v, 7v, 8r, 8v, 9r, 11r, 11v, 12r, 12v, 13r, etc. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: e.g., fols. 13v, 14r, 16r, 22v, 30r, 34r. - The line is taken up: e.g., fols. 11v, 20v, 29v, 48r, 66r, 84. - The line is taken down on fol. 20r. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margin, belong: fols. 143va l.11, 144ra l.2. - Immediate corrections indicated by thin lines above and below words or encircling the letters: e.g., fol. 5v. - Omitted lines are written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 57r, 84r, 88v, 106r, 142v. - Hardly readable note ደብረ፡ ብርሃን፡ ያስክሮች...(?): fol. 1r, below. - An erased donation or ownership note, in the main hand: fol. 76v. - Crude notes and scribbles, in recent hands: fols. 11v, 12r, 17v, 18r, 25v, 26r, 34v, 35r, 42v, 46v, 47r, 55r, 64v, 65r, 72, 86v, 87r, 94v, 110v, 129r, 130v, 147v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Simply decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of fols. 13r, 21r, 29r, 37r, 45r, 53r, 61r, 69r, 77r, 85r, 93r, 95r, 103r, 111r, 119r, 139r.

miniature.info: Fol. 93v: A noble commissioner receiving a book from a scribe (?).
miniature.details: Unfinished coloured image; the scene possibly depicts how the noble commissioner of the Ms. received the book from a scribe (cp. WQ-007, fol. 159v); a group of soldiers accompanies him. The unruled bifolio was sewn into the Ms. at a later time.

miniature.info: Fol. 94r: An angel with a sword catching the devil.
miniature.details: Unfinished coloured image of an angel (Mikaʾel) with a sword fighting a devil; a prone male figure below (donor?). The unruled bifolio was sewn into the Ms. at a later time.

miniature.info: Fol 129v: St. George slaying the dragon.
miniature.details: Coloured image of St. George on a white horse slaying the dragon. The unruled bifolio was sewn into the Ms. at a later time.
Coloured image of Mary with the child, angels to both sides. The donor prostrates below. The unruled bifolio was sewn into the Ms. at a later time.

frames.frame: - Fol. 5r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the text area; interlaces and floral motifs. - Fol. 41v: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band; interlaces and floral motifs. - Fol. 77r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the text area; interlaces, and floral motifs. - Fol. 111r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the text area; interlaces, and floral motifs. - Fol. 122v: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band; interlaces and geometric motifs. - Fol. 131r: elaborate coloured (blue, red, black) ornamental band with three lateral pendants pointed down the entire text area; interlaces, and floral motifs.
